alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:22AM CST until February 26 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Morris, Ottawa, La Salle...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Illinois River at Ottawa. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 462.5 feet, the roadway entrance to Allen Park is threatened and the Allen Park west boat ramp is inundated in Ottawa. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 461.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 462.5 feet early Thursday morning. - Action stage is 461.0 feet. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by 11 PM CST this evening.
